daboross.code.engine

Class OverlayHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • daboross.code.engine.OverlayHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Paintable, java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class OverlayHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, Paintable
    This is a class to handle things that should be overlaid over the rest of the game

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean isIn 
      private boolean isPressed 
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.event.MouseListener> mouseListeners 
      private int mouseXPos 
      private int mouseYPos 
      private ObjectHandler objectHandler 
      private java.util.ArrayList<OverlayButton> overlayButtons 
      private java.awt.image.BufferedImage pauseOverlayImage 
      private boolean pauseOverlayOn 
      static int TYPE_BOTH
      When specified as a type for a button, the button will appear both when there is a pause overlay and when there is not
      static int TYPE_PAUSEONLY
      When this is specified as a type for a button, the button will only appear of a pause overlay is on
      static int TYPE_UNPAUSEONLY
      When this is specified as a type for a button, the button will only appear when there is no pause overlay on

      OverlayHandler(ObjectHandler objectHandler)
      Creates a new Overlay Handler, should only be used once per program

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Run this function to have the overlay handler paint all of the overlays/buttons onto the graphics provided
        Specified by:
        paint in interface Paintable
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics to paint to.

      • setPauseOverlay

        public void setPauseOverlay(java.awt.image.BufferedImage i)
        This creates a new overlay that will be drawn over the rest of the game. If there is already a PauseOverlay then this function will overwrite it
        Parameters:
        i - This is the image to overlay

      • removePauseOverlay

        public void removePauseOverlay()
        This removes the current pause overlay

      • isOverlayOn

        public boolean isOverlayOn()
        This function checks if there is currently a pause overlay @return Whether of not there is a Pause Overlay

      • addButton

        public boolean addButton(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                int xPos,
                int yPos,
                ButtonReactor buttonReactor,
                int type)
        This adds a button to the screen which will react when clicked.
        Parameters:
        xPos - this is the x position of the button
        yPos - this is the y position of the button
        img - this is the image to paint the button as
        type - this is the type of button to have, use one of the constants from Overlay Button
        buttonReactor - the button will call the react() function of this class when it is clicked
        Returns:
        This will return true if you have successfully added a button, false otherwise
        See Also:
        TYPE_PAUSEONLY, TYPE_UNPAUSEONLY, TYPE_BOTH

      • addButton

        public boolean addButton(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                int xPos,
                int yPos,
                int xLength,
                int yLength,
                ButtonReactor buttonReactor,
                int type)
        This adds a button to the screen which will react when clicked.
        Parameters:
        xPos - this is the x position of the button
        yPos - this is the y position of the button
        xLength - This is the horizontal length of the button
        yLength - This is the vertical length of the button
        img - this is the image to paint the button as
        type - this is the type of button to have, use one of the constants from Overlay Button
        buttonReactor - the button will call the react() function of this class when it is clicked
        Returns:
        This will return true if you have successfully added a button, false otherwise
        See Also:
        TYPE_PAUSEONLY, TYPE_UNPAUSEONLY, TYPE_BOTH

      • addButton

        public boolean addButton(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                java.awt.image.BufferedImage hoveredImage,
                int xPos,
                int yPos,
                int xLength,
                int yLength,
                ButtonReactor buttonReactor,
                int type)
        This adds a button to the screen which will react when clicked.
        Parameters:
        xPos - this is the x position of the button
        yPos - this is the y position of the button
        xLength - This is the horizontal length of the button
        yLength - This is the vertical length of the button
        img - this is the image to paint the button as
        hoveredImage - this is the image to paint the button as when it is being hovered over
        type - this is the type of button to have, use one of the constants from Overlay Button
        buttonReactor - the button will call the react() function of this class when it is clicked
        Returns:
        This will return true if you have successfully added a button, false otherwise
        See Also:
        TYPE_PAUSEONLY, TYPE_UNPAUSEONLY, TYPE_BOTH
